documents.document: @Pseudony_Ms @mysphoria (I just hate the myth that she DIDN'T appeal to people, because she did, pretty well.)
@Pseudony_Ms @mysphoria you mean, in the way she got more votes than anybody except Obama, historically...?
@Pseudony_Ms like I said, I get you, but every vote the left does NOT get makes NZF's chances of government better.
@Pseudony_Ms I understand where you're coming from, but abstaining from voting doesn't actually fix anything.
@Pseudony_Ms you have two votes!
@Brekekekiwi it wasn't *perfect*, but I didn't realise how good it was going to be to see a Disney movie that looked & sounded like home.
I think I cried as much as I did in Rogue One but for 100% diametrically opposite reasons.
I know I'm late on this (I WAS ON A BOAT ALL JANUARY OK) but MOANA, guys, oh my god.
@GrumpyYetAmusin well, yeah, but a genuine military coup attempt - which would *not* be universal - would make it a way easier sell.
@GrumpyYetAmusin and a *failed* coup would be how good an excuse for a crackdown?
Having done this, for a short period of time: it FUCKING SUCKS, and I had pretty good assurance it wasn't forever. https://t.co/504Tgz6Fpy
@DubiousStephen oh, how cool! I've sailed on the Falkor. It's a lovely ship. Didn't have SuBastian when I was on it, though - we took ROPOS.
@hungrymama @grumpybirb it made me mildly uncomfortable in the early 2000s but not like it would now
@grumpybirb @hungrymama I really like all the Tor re-reads - they're very thoughtful.
@hungrymama imo it gets worse as the Dune books go on. Frank Herbet just did not like or trust women at ALL.
@hungrymama https://t.co/NRInhh4Uqq are doing a re-read of Dune right now and this is definitely front and centre as an item of discussion
@justin_lester holy crap, glad you're ok! Hell of a way to end the week.
@tui_talk well, how can it be censorship when a government run by white dudes is doing it?
Can we all spell "censorship"? Cool. https://t.co/9dlVIqU1LR
@Pseudony_Ms this is why @mysphoria and I moved out on our own after three years of flatting and have never regretted it.
@Pseudony_Ms nah, I get it. I just wouldn't get your hopes up about it changing.
@Pseudony_Ms if it makes you feel better office kitchen horror stories seem to be universal, it's not just students
@Pseudony_Ms I take it you've never flatted with PhD students then
Not thinking about weather and equipment so much anymore. Ten months seems like a long time right now.
At the time I was mostly thinking of weather/eqpt issues, getting samples from the deep sea is HARD and you should never count yr chickens.
Literally last week I had a conversation saying I wasn't going to bank on getting samples from a cruise with US scientists later this year
@lilith_grace all my sympathies.
@nicgaston terrifyingly, yep.
@nicgaston 'it's not that I think women shouldn't vote the world was just better when they didn't why are you making that face at me'
Hey, everybody who was like 'maybe it won't be that bad'? IT'S BEEN LESS THAN A WEEK. https://t.co/0K2J9QFzhI
That last retweet - I didn't know that about ResearchGate, but it's mostly been a source of spam-y emails for me anyway, so not surprising.
@Pseudony_Ms there are a few US comedies I really enjoy (e.g. Brooklyn Nine-Nine, Better Off Ted) but it's a fingers of one hand thing.
@Pseudony_Ms right, precisely, plus a lot of American-style humour (body parts are funny, etc) that just doesn't work for me.
@Pseudony_Ms nah. I don't find the funny:hideously not funny ratio high enough to deliberately watch it.
@dimsie @gtiso @johubris @BeeFaerie that's certainly one way to put it
@dimsie @gtiso @johubris @BeeFaerie while I was at sea this month we had salads that I swear were half raw tomato and half raw onion
Just in case you haven't read enough about the #hydrothermadec cruise yet https://t.co/Ke9XO88jnY
@yinbagua never feel any shame about blocking trolls. you don't owe them your attention.
Hey @mysphoria we should go here when you're back in town https://t.co/R7w80bd9bN
@HamishMack @tui_talk seems likely. Or is the favourite food of drop bears.
@tui_talk IDK but my money says they're poisonous, because Australia
Man, Wellington, if this is the 'summer' I missed out on, I'd like to petition to get back on the ship.
@tui_talk also a great option, mostly meant that the key for hot climes/aircon is layering
@Brekekekiwi soooooo good. (Also, she's 13 now? Oh my god. I've known you forever.)
@Brekekekiwi just about to fly back to Wgtn, huzzah
@Brekekekiwi 100% possible since I'm sitting in the bar/coffee place in the Akld domestic terminal as I type
@tui_talk cardigans are your friend in this environment.
Our cruise is over, but somebody else's is just beginning...that's another ROV waiting to board the Sonne. https://t.co/gMcC1opT7p
I...think that's my parents front and centre there. Go my parents! https://t.co/OTtrdsRDtN
Aroha and good wishes to everybody marching today in Wgtn/Akld/Chch and elsewhere.
The North Island is lurking just over the edge of the world. Almost home! #hydrothermadec https://t.co/RSF3Wjla74
This is the ship I've been on for the last month! Come check it out next week, Aucklanders. https://t.co/GSf1vFJhJr
Our final science meeting & Marcel from the ROV QUEST team is showing us the highlights tape. Twelve minutes of won… https://t.co/auv6ex8GaW
@methanoJen not in stuff I edit before sending out (e.g. pubs), at least I HOPE not. *goes back to check the grant I'm writing*
@methanoJen I...totally do this a lot and I know it's wrong.
Getting a bit bumpy as we slowly head south and the storm rolls north - glad we didn't get any of this while we were diving. #hydrothermadec
Everybody talking about submitting their #abscicon abstracts is making me sad I can't go. :/ I hope you're all going to livetweet it!
@lilith_grace so sorry to hear that.
Honestly everything you need to know about the NZ Herald https://t.co/xd0hl6bBFO
@merenbey luckily this is a problem which a) has an obvious solution and b) you are in full control of addressing.
Our last dive today! I'd say it feels like we just started but tbh it's been a long (and very productive) month at sea. #hydrothermadec
@bonniej1 @dimsie I used to cover my eyes/ears a lot for that show before I noped out but not for embarrassment...
@dimsie cover my ears. The dialogue is usually the worst bit. Or just leave the room. I have a VERY low fictional embarrassment threshold.
'Hot' in this case meaning >>100C. A source of some confusion between the biologists & geologists at times -'hot' for bio is a lot lower!
Back at Brothers for our last couple of dives after we couldn't find any hot fluids at Rumble III. Perils of exploration! #hydrothermadec
@tui_talk I think I'm going to be thrashing Beautiful Collision when I'm fifty, tbh
@Pseudony_Ms it's all fun and games until somebody drops sulfuric acid on their bare foot...
@Pseudony_Ms a humanities thing that...sandals & labs don't mix well, sadly!
@dimsie this is one of my favourite weird facts ever
@methanoJen exactly. It's my first stop for info on many things, so I should make sure other people are getting the right info on my area!
@methanoJen six years later, on the one hand, screw them, OTOH I probably shd find time for that now I actually know some things abt vents.
@methanoJen and a bunch of old white dudes immediately told me 1) it was a terrible idea and 2) I should go do it myself then.
@methanoJen I once suggested at a Ridge2000 meeting a quick & effective way to do vent outreach would be to fix up Wikipedia pages
@secvalve it really does
@secvalve I googled a bit, found it. (Took me a bit to figure out that suggestion...)
@secvalve nope, not that. Webpage (on phone) I need is 404ing anyway even though link is from a doc issued august 2016. Aaaaaaargh.
Hmm, ok, just my laptop it seems - can access on my phone ok. On the same internet connection. Who the fuck knows.
I can't access any .govt.nz sites right now. Admittedly am On A Boat, but internet is definitely working. Anyone else having issues?
These tweets brought to you by wondering if hydrothermal vents were discovered pre or post-GPS (it was post, btw, 1979.)
This is a very big and (to me) very featureless ocean, and yet.
If you want to get a real feel for the scale of Māori achievement in settling NZ just spend a few days bobbing around in the Pacific
(Would have shown you a picture but the still semi-miraculous mid-ocean internet is not cooperating tonight)
Current status: making cooing noises at microbial mats and diffuse venting, like a real microbiologist #hydrothermadec
@tui_talk aw thank you :)
Today we're exploring Rumble III, which is a very dynamic & relatively unexplored volcano. Who knows what we'll find! #hydrothermadec
@LewSOS I know, it's baked into the culture, it's that he doesn't get that *that's what people object to*.
@LewSOS amazing how the argument still so heavily relies on the basic premises of fear that drive current gun ownership
@testeeves thank you! So excited to be doing science in NZ again.
@secvalve hah, exactly like hackers and con shirts except mostly you only get one or two a year
Rocking my new Sonne fleece (like most vent scientists I have a million ship & ROV t-shirts, a fleece is a nice cha… https://t.co/DMzvaTLziD
I cook hot seawater in ovens so I can count the bugs in it. Sometimes I do this on boats. https://t.co/ipMPWm7an0
@lilith_grace they're pretty neat-looking. Hopefully also scientifically interesting for my geologist colleagues!
Ooh, shiny - this is pyrite but some sulfide chimneys at Brothers do contain gold and copper, previous studies have… https://t.co/Wg38YsEmW2
@dazyndara ugh I remember that feeling. Worst time of year to be looking. :/
@lilith_grace I think the blog has some much better official vent chimney pics, though obvs not from today: https://t.co/mtigKDFXtr
@lilith_grace it looks way better when it's not my 3.5-year-old phone taking a picture of picture on a tv screen, I promise
@aurynn not really all the island are marine reserves and obvs we wouldn't want to interfere with reserves
@aurynn the engine workshop has pretty much everything, I'm sure we could figure something out
We can make our own fresh water and catch fish or something. Turn off the internet connection. Seriously. So tempting.
I was told today on an engine room tour the Sonne has enough fuel to stay at sea for 2-3 months & the news is making that seem a great idea
